gurmukhi: BUpj bXwh jbY gH Awey ]bwjq BwNiq Anyk bDwey ]
transliteration: Bhoopat Byaah Jabai Grah Aae|| Baajat Bhaant(i) Anek Badhaae||
translation: When the princes came home after their marriage, then many kinds of congratulatory songs were sung.

gurmukhi: qwq bisst suimqR bulwey ]Aaur Anyk qhwN irK Awey ]181]
transliteration: Taat Basist Soumita Bulaae|| Aur Anek Tahaan Rich Aae||181||
translation: Dasrath called Vasishtha and Sumantra and with them came several other sages.181.

gurmukhi: Gor auTI Ghrwie Gtw qb ]cwro ids idg dwh lKXo sB ]
transliteration: Ghor Outhighahraae Ghataa Tab|| Chdaro Dis Dig Daah Lakhyo Sabh||
translation: At that time the clouds gathered on all the four sides and all saw apparently the flames of fire in all the four directions.

gurmukhi: mMqRI imqR sBY Akulwny ]BUpq so ieh BwNq bKwny ]182]
transliteration: Mantrimitra Sabhai Akulaane|| Bhoopat So Eh Bhaant Bakhaane||182||
translation: On seeing this all the ministers and friends became worried and request the king in the following manner.182.

gurmukhi: hoq auqpwq bfy sun rwjn ]mMqR kro irK jor smwjn ]
transliteration: Hot Outpaat Bade Soun Raajan|| Mantra Daro Rikh Jor Samaajan||
translation: “O King ! There are many cases of providential wrath, tumult on all the four sides, therefore give thought to them by calling all the sages and advisers.

gurmukhi: bolhu ib`p iblMb n kIjY ]hY kiRq j`g ArMBn kIjY ]183]
transliteration: Badoh Bipp Bilanb Na Keejai|| Hai Krit Jagg Aranbhan Keejai||183||
translation: “Call the Brahmins without delay and begin Krit Yajna.183.

gurmukhi: Awies rwj dXo qqkwlh ]mMqR su im`qH bu`D ibswlh ]
transliteration: Aais Raaj Dayo Tatkaalah|| Mantra Su Mittrah Buddh Bidaalah||
translation: “O King ! give instant orders for starting the Krit Yajna without delay,

gurmukhi: hY kiRq j`g ArMBn kIjY ]Awies byg nrys krIjY ]184]
transliteration: Hai Krit Jagg Aranbhan Keejai|| Aais Beg Dares Dareejai||184||
translation: “In view of the great wisdom of friends and ministers.”184.

gurmukhi: bol bfy irK lIn mhwN idj ]hY iqn bol lXo ju qirqj ]
transliteration: Bol Bade Rikh Leen Mahaan Dij|| Hai Tin Bol Layo Ju Taritaj||
translation: The king called he eminent sages and great friends soon.

gurmukhi: pwvk kuMf KudXo iqh Aausr ]gwifX KMB qhwN DrmM Dr ]185]
transliteration: Paavak Kound Khudyo Tih Aousar|| Gaddiya Khanbh Tahaan Dharamannd Dhar||185||
translation: The sacrificial pit was dug up there and a pillar of righteousness was established.185.

gurmukhi: Coir lXo hXswrh qy hX ]Aisq krn pRBwsq kykX ]
transliteration: Chhodh(i) Layo Haysaarah Te Haya|| Asit Karan Prabhaasat Kekaya||
translation: A horse was let off from the stable so that ending the glory of other king they may be conquered.

gurmukhi: dysn dys nrys dey sMig ]suMdr sUr surMg suBY AMg ]186]
transliteration: Desan Des Dares Dae San(i)|| Soundar Soor Suran Soubhai An||186||
translation: The kings several countries were sent alongwith the horse and all of them were persons of beauteous limbs and the enhancer of glory.186.

gurmukhi: nrys sMig kY dey ]pRbIn bIn kY ley ]
transliteration: Dares San(i) Kai Dae|| Prabeen Been Kai Lae||
translation: The king Dasrath made selection of other efficient kings and sent them with the horse.
